Published for the Early English Text Society by Humphrey Milford, Oxford University Press
<name>Published for the Early English Text Society by Humphrey Milford, Oxford University Press</name>
<description type="note">Preliminaries and introductory material omitted<lb/>The following plays have been taken from this source:</description>

<description type="note">Copyright (c) 1922, Early English Text Society. This text may not be reproduced, except for fair dealing purposes, without the express permission of Chadwyck-Healey and the copyright holder.</description>
Genre: English mystery and miracle plays.

Joseph How dame how vn-do ?oure dore vn-do Are ?e at hom why speke ?e notht Susanna Who is ther why cry ?e so telle us ?our herand wyl ?e ought. Joseph Vn-do ?our dore I sey ?ow to Ffor to com in is all my thought. Maria it is my spowse þat spekyth us to On-do þe dore his wyl were wrought. well-come hom myn husbond dere how haue ?e ferd in fer countre. Joseph To gete oure levynge with-owtyn dwere I haue sore laboryd ffor þe and me. Maria husbond ryght gracyously now come be ?e it solacyth me sore sothly to se ?ow in syth. Joseph Me merveylyth wyff surely ?our face I can not se but as þe sonne with his bemys quan he is most bryth. Maria Husbond it is as it plesyth oure lord þat grace of hym grew Who þat evyr be-holdyth me veryly they xal be grettly steryed to vertu ffor þis ?yfte and many moo good lord gramercy. Joseph How hast þou ferde jentyl mayde whyl I haue be out of londe. Maria Sekyr sere beth nowth dysmayde Ryth aftyr þe wyl of goddys sonde. joseph That semyth evyl I am afrayd þi wombe to hy?e doth stonde I drede me sore I am be-trayd Sum other man þe had in honde Hens sythe þat I went Thy Wombe is gret it gynnyth to ryse than hast þou be-gownne a synfull gyse telle me now in what wyse thy self þou Ast þus schent. Ow dame what þinge menyth this with childe þou gynnyst ryth gret to gon Sey me mary þis childys fadyr ho is I pray þe telle me and þat anon Maria The fadyr of hevyn and ?e it is other fadyr hath he non I dede nevyr forfete with man i-wys Wher-fore I pray ?ow amende ?our mon this childe is goddys and ?our. Joseph Goddys childe þou lyist in fay God dede nevyr jape so with may And I cam nevyr ther I dare wel say ?itt so nyh þi boure But ?it I sey mary whoos childe is this. Maria Goddys and ?oure I sey i-wys. Joseph ?a ?a all Olde men to me take tent and weddyth no wyff in no kynnys wyse þat is a ?onge wench be myn a-sent ffor doute and drede and swych servyse Alas Alas my name is shent all men may me now dyspyse and seyn olde cokwold þi bow is bent newly now after þe frensche gyse Alas and welaway Alas dame why dedyst þou so Ffor þis synne þat þou hast do I the for-sake and from þe go Ffor onys evyr and Ay. Maria Alas gode spowse why sey ?e thus Alas dere hosbund a-mende ?our mod It is no man but swete jhesus he wyll be clad in flesch and blood and of ?our wyff be born. Sephor Ffor sothe þe Aungel þus seyd he þat goddys sone in trynite Ffor mannys sake a man wolde be to save þat is for-lorn. Joseph An Aungel allas alas fy for schame ?e syn now in þat ?e to say to puttyn an Aungel in so gret blame Alas alas let be do way It was sum boy be-gan þis game þat clothyd was clene and gay and ?e ?eve hym now an Aungel name Alas alas and wel away þat evyr this game be-tydde A dame what thought haddyst þou Here may all men þis proverbe trow þat many a man doth bete þe bow Another man hath þe brydde. Maria A gracyous god in hefne trone comforte my spowse in þis hard cas mercyful god A-mend his mone as I dede nevyr so gret trespas. Joseph Lo Lo Serys What told I ?ow þat it was not for my prow A wyff to take me to An þat is wel sene now Ffor mary I make god A-vow is grett with childe lo Alas why is it so to þe busshop I wole it telle þat he þe law may here do With stonys here to qwelle. Nay nay ?et god ffor-bede þat I xuld do þat vegeabyl dede but if I wyst wel qwy I knew never with here so god me spede tokyn of thynge in word nor dede þat towchyd velany nevyr þe les what for thy þow she be meke and mylde With-owth mannys company she myght not be with childe. But I ensure myn was it nevyr thow þat she hath not don here devyr rather than I xuld pleynyn opynly Serteynly ?itt had I levyr Ffor sake þe countre ffor evyr and nevyr come in here company Ffor and men knew þis velany In repreff þei wolde me holde and ?ett many bettyr than I ?a hath ben made cokolde Now alas whedyr xal I gone I wot nevyr whedyr nor to what place ffor oftyn tyme sorwe comyth sone and longe it is or it pace no comforte may I haue here I-wys wyff þou dedyst me wronge Alas I taryed from þe to longe All men haue pety on me amonge Ffor to my sorwe is no chere. Maria God þat in my body Art sesyd þou knowist myn husbond is dysplesyd to se me in þis plight Ffor vnknowlage he is desesyd and þerfore help þat he were esyd þat he myght knowe þe ful perfyght Ffor I haue levyr abyde respyt to kepe þi sone in priuite grauntyd by þe holy spyryt þan þat it xulde be opynd by me. Deus Descende I sey myn Aungelle on to joseph for to telle such as my wyl is byd hym with mary A-byde and dwelle Ffor it is my sone fful snelle þat she is with i-wys. Angelus Almyghty god of blys I am redy ffor to wende wedyr as þi wyl is to go bothe fer and hynde Joseph Joseph þou wepyst shyrle ffro þi wyff why comyst þou owte. Joseph Good sere lete me wepe my ffylle Go forthe þi wey and lett me nowght. Angelus In þi wepynge þou dost ryght ylle A-?ens god þou hast mys-wrought Go chere þi wyff with herty wylle and chawnge þi chere Amende þi thought Sche is a ful clene may I telle þe god wyl of here be born And sche clene mayd as she was be-forn to saue mankynd þat is for-lorn Go chere hyre þerfore I say. Joseph A lord god benedicite of þi gret comforte I thank the þat þou sent me þis space I myght wel A wyst parde So good a creature as she wold nevyr A done trespace For sche is ful of grace I know wel I haue myswrought I walk to my pore place and Aske ffor-gyfnes I haue mys-thought. Now is þe tyme sen At eye þat þe childe is now to veryfye which xal saue mankende As it was spoke be prophesye I thank þe god þat syttys on hye with hert wyl and mende þat evyr þou woldyst me bynde to wedde mary to my wyff þi blysful sone so nere to fynde In his presens to lede my lyff. Alas ffor joy I qwedyr and qwake Alas what hap now was this A mercy mercy my jentyl make mercy I haue seyd al Amys All þat I haue seyd here I for-sake ?our swete fete now lete me kys. Mary Nay lett be my fete not þo ?e take my mowthe ?e may kys i-wys and welcom on to me. Joseph Gramercy myn owyn swete wyff gramercy myn hert my love my lyff xal I nevyr more make suche stryff be-twyx me and þe. A mary mary wel þou be and blyssyd be þe frewte in the goddys sone of myght now good wyff fful of pyte as be not evyl payd with me þow þat þou haue good ryght As for my wronge in syght to wyte þe with ony synne had þou not be A vertuous wythe god wold not A be þe with-inne. I knowlage I haue don A-mys I was never wurthy i-wys ffor to be þin husbonde I xal amende Aftere thys ryght as þin owyn wyl is to serve þe at foot and honde and þi chylde bothe to vndyr-stonde to wurchep hym with good Affeccion and þerfore telle me and nothynge whonde the holy matere of ?our concepcion. Maria At ?owre owyn wyll as ?e bydde me ther cam An Aunge hyght Gabryell and gret me ffayr and seyd Aue And ferther more to me gan tell God xulde be borne of my bode þe ffendys pouste ffor to ffelle þorwe þe holy gost as I wel se þus god in me wyl byde and dwelle. Joseph Now I thank god with spech and spelle þat Euyr mary I was weddyd to the. Mary it was þe werk of god as I ?ow telle now blyssyd be þat lord so purveyd for me.
